item.title: BPSC protest: Bihar Police detains Prashant Kishor from Gandhi Maidan in Patna - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Detained During Hunger Strike for BPSC Exam Protest

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

Prashant Kishor, chief of Jan Suraaj, has been detained by Bihar Police while on an indefinite hunger strike at Gandhi Maidan, protesting against irregularities in the BPSC examination and demanding the cancellation of the integrated 70th combined competitive test conducted in December.

  • Kishor's hunger strike aimed to draw attention to alleged irregularities in the BPSC examination.
  • He claims the government's decision to conduct a re-examination acknowledges errors in the initial testing process.
  • Over 12,000 candidates were called for a fresh test; however, only 5,943 appeared.
  • Kishor has called for political support to amplify the protest.
“By conducting the re-examination, the government has legally accepted that irregularities have happened with certain students in the examination.” – Prashant Kishor

This ongoing protest highlights significant concerns regarding the integrity of public examinations in Bihar and the need for government accountability.

item.title: Tourists escape drowning in frozen Sela Lake - The Arunachal Times
item.description:
Tourists Escape Drowning in Frozen Sela Lake

Date: 5 Jan | Source: Arunachal Times

Four tourists had a narrow escape at Sela Lake when they fell through the ice while trying to walk on the frozen surface. Their companions quickly rescued them.

  • The incident involved a group of four tourists, including a woman.
  • Despite warnings from local authorities, tourists have continued to walk on frozen lakes in the region.
  • High-altitude lakes like Sela Lake are considered sacred by local traditions.
“Fiddling with or polluting such lakes invites fatal trouble.”

This incident serves as a vital reminder of the dangers associated with walking on frozen bodies of water, especially in high-altitude areas.

item.title: Namo Bharat Trains Now In Delhi: All You Need To Know About RRTS Corridor To Meerut | Explained - News18
item.description:
Namo Bharat Trains Now In Delhi: All You Need To Know About RRTS Corridor To Meerut

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Delhi section of the RRTS, marking the arrival of Namo Bharat trains in the capital. This 13-km section connects Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh to New Ashok Nagar, completing a 55 km corridor with 11 stations.

  • The operation will begin at 5 pm with trains available every 15 minutes.
  • The fare ranges from Rs 20 to Rs 225 depending on coach type.
  • The RRTS aims to alleviate traffic, remove over one lakh private vehicles, and reduce carbon emissions annually.
  • New Ashok Nagar is the first elevated station in this corridor.
  • Multiple operational stations now connect Meerut directly to Delhi.
“The project will push employment generation and open up new commercial hubs across NCR.”

This new transport system is designed to enhance regional connectivity and ease the commuting burden for residents of NCR.

item.title: After remarks on Priyanka Gandhi, BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri's comment on Atishi sparks row - Hindustan Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India - News18
item.description:
US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

American influencer Kristen Fischer discusses her cultural challenges with Indian dinner traditions, highlighting how they differ from American customs.

  • Fischer has lived in New Delhi for several years.
  • In the US, meals are served upon guests' arrival; in India, they are served at the end of gatherings.
  • Food is often served much later in India, leading to feelings of hunger and confusion for guests used to American customs.
  • Fischer expressed her struggle to adapt, finding the delay in dinner challenging.
  • She shared experiences of leaving friends' homes late without being served dinner.
“I can’t be the only one who struggles with this cultural difference. It is so hard for me!”

The cultural differences in dining etiquette highlight the significance of understanding diverse traditions and their impacts on social gatherings.

item.title: P.V. Anvar arrested after day-long standoff over tribal youth’s death in elephant attack - The Hindu
item.description:
P.V. Anvar Arrested Following Standoff Over Tribal Youth's Death in Elephant Attack

Published: January 05, 2025 10:59 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

P.V. Anvar, an Independent MLA, was arrested after a day-long standoff with police following an attack on the Divisional Forest Office during a protest over a tribal youth's death caused by an elephant attack.

  • Anvar surrendered after police surrounded his house in Othai, Kerala.
  • He criticized Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan for using police action against him.
  • Anvar claimed he was targeted for speaking out on behalf of farmers in the Christian community.
  • The protest was ignited by the death of a tribal man, Mani, who was trampled by an elephant.
  • The government announced ₹10 lakh assistance to Mani's family.
“I will show what I can do if I come back alive,” P.V. Anvar stated during his arrest.

The incident has drawn significant attention to the ongoing issues around wildlife interactions and local communities in Kerala.

item.title: Unable to speak, stand up: Doctors, SKM leaders offer health update on Jagjit Singh Dallewal - The Times of India
item.description:
Health Update on Jagjit Singh Dallewal: Unable to Speak or Stand

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: Times of India

Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a key figure in the ongoing farmer's protests, has reportedly faced severe health challenges, making him unable to speak or stand.

  • Dallewal is currently under medical care.
  • Doctors express concern over his deteriorating health condition.
  • He remains a prominent voice among farmers despite his health issues.
  • Supporters are rallying around him during this tough time.
"His health has taken a turn for the worse, and we are monitoring the situation closely." - Medical Team

The situation calls for immediate attention as Dallewal continues to be an influential leader in the movement.

item.title: 'Atishi changed her father': After Priyanka comment, BJP's Bidhuri lands in more trouble; 'shameless', sa - The Times of India
item.description:
BJP's Bidhuri Faces Backlash After Priyanka's Comments, Kejriwal Calls Him 'Shameless'

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

After a comment made by Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi, BJP's Bidhuri has found himself in hot water, leading to sharp criticism from various political figures, including Arvind Kejriwal, who labeled him as 'shameless'.

  • Bidhuri's controversial remarks came in response to Priyanka's statements regarding his political actions.
  • Kejriwal's strident remarks highlight the increasing tensions in political discourse.
  • This incident has drawn attention to the political dynamics between BJP and Congress as elections approach.
'Shameless' is how Kejriwal described Bidhuri's comments following Priyanka's statements.

This incident underscores the fierce nature of current political debates in India and the growing scrutiny politicians face for their comments.

item.title: Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut | Weather wrap - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A severe cold wave and dense fog have resulted in freezing temperatures and significantly reduced visibility across northern India, prompting widespread disruptions in transportation.

  • Delhi experienced its longest spell of fog, leading to cancellations of hundreds of flights and trains due to zero visibility conditions.
  • In Jharkhand, schools will be closed from January 7-13 due to the cold wave affecting the region.
  • Kashmir saw fresh snowfall while temperatures dipped to below freezing in various areas, with Kokernag recording minus 8.1 degrees Celsius.
  • Cold conditions persisted in Punjab and Haryana with minimum temperatures dropping significantly.
  • Many schools in Bihar's Patna also closed due to ongoing cold wave conditions.
The maximum temperature in Delhi settled at 18.6 degrees Celsius, while the minimum was recorded at 9.4 degrees Celsius.

As weather conditions remain concerning, authorities anticipate further cold weather and possible rain and thunderstorms in the coming days.

item.title: Mukesh Chandrakar: Body of missing Indian journalist found in septic tank - BBC.com
item.description:
Body of Missing Indian Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar Found

Publication Date: January 5, 2023 | Source: Various Media Outlets

The body of Mukesh Chandrakar, a journalist who reported on corruption, has been discovered in a septic tank in Chhattisgarh after he went missing on New Year's Day. His family had filed a police complaint when he disappeared.

Key Points:

  • Mukesh Chandrakar was reported missing on January 1, 2023.
  • His body was found on January 5 in the compound of a construction contractor.
  • Three arrests have been made, including two relatives.
  • Police found severe injuries indicating a violent death.
  • Bastar Junction, his YouTube channel, reported on local corruption.
  • The Press Council of India is calling for a full investigation.
  • Local journalists held protests following his death.
“Attacks on journalists reporting on corruption or environmental degradation is not uncommon in India.” - Reporters Without Borders

This incident highlights the dangers faced by journalists in India, particularly those reporting on sensitive issues like corruption.

item.title: Parvesh Verma, Arvind Kejriwal's New Delhi rival, makes big 'Sheesh Mahal' attack: 'Declare it...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parvesh Verma Accuses Arvind Kejriwal Over 'Sheesh Mahal'

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Parvesh Verma, a former BJP MP, has launched an attack on AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal, calling for his official residence to be declared a tourist spot as a critique of alleged misuse of taxpayer money.

  • Parvesh Verma has been named the BJP's candidate for New Delhi in upcoming elections.
  • He claims the construction of Kejriwal's 'Sheesh Mahal' used public funds, demanding transparency.
  • Verma stated, 'People should know how Kejriwal looted them,' expressing a desire for public access to the residence.
  • Prime Minister Modi has also criticized the AAP for perceived inaction over the years, promoting the BJP's agenda.
  • Kejriwal has rebutted Modi's criticisms, arguing they detract from the issues faced by Delhi's residents.
“Sheesh Mahal should be declared a tourist spot. The people of Delhi should know how the person who looted, betrayed, Delhi, who sold their dreams, got the 'Sheesh Mahal' built.” - Parvesh Verma

This political rivalry heats up as Delhi heads toward the 2025 assembly elections, showcasing divergent strategies and narratives from the BJP and AAP.

item.title: With PM Modi expected to visit Paris in February, deals to buy Rafale fighter jets, Scorpene subs for Navy reach final stage - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Set to Visit Paris as Defense Deals with France Near Completion

Published on: January 05, 2025

Source: The Hindu

India is finalizing two major defense deals with France worth over $10 billion ahead of PM Modi's expected visit to Paris for an AI summit. The deals include 26 Rafale-M fighter jets and three additional Scorpene-class submarines for the Indian Navy.

  • The expected visit by PM Modi is tied to the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit hosted by French President Emmanuel Macron.
  • The procurement includes 26 Rafale-M jets for aircraft carriers and three Scorpene submarines, set for approval by Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS).
  • The Navy intends to complete the deals shortly, with expectations of formal agreements as soon as next month.
  • This purchase aims to enhance naval capabilities amid aging fleet concerns.
“It is just a matter of completing the formalities of the acquisition process and we expect that if not this month, next month, hopefully, this [Scorpene submarine] and the Rafale-M deal should be signed.” - Navy Chief Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi

This visit and the completion of the deals will reinforce India-France defense relations and support India's naval modernization efforts.

item.title: IC 814 fame Captain Devi Sharan retires: 'Will always be looking at co-passengers to ensure nothing’s wro - The Times of India
item.description:
Captain Devi Sharan Retires: 'Will Always Be Looking at Co-Passengers to Ensure Nothing’s Wrong'

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Captain Devi Sharan, known for his heroic actions during the IC 814 hijacking, has officially announced his retirement, reflecting on his experiences and commitment to safety.

  • Captain Sharan served in a pivotal role during the IC 814 hijacking incident.
  • He emphasizes the importance of vigilance, stating he will continue to observe co-passengers closely.
  • The announcement marks the end of a significant chapter in his aviation career.
"I will always be looking at co-passengers to ensure nothing’s wrong."

In conclusion, Captain Sharan's retirement highlights a legacy of dedication to passenger safety and remarkable leadership in crisis situations.

item.title: Centre rolls back GRAP-3 pollution curbs in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves - The Times of India
item.description:
Centre rolls back GRAP-3 pollution curbs in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves

Publication Date: October 23, 2023

Source: Times of India

As air quality in Delhi-NCR improves, the government has decided to roll back GRAP-3 pollution restrictions previously implemented during poor air quality days.

  • The rollback is a response to the recent improvement in the Air Quality Index (AQI).
  • GRAP-3 measures included actions such as banning construction activities and capping vehicle usage to combat severe pollution.
  • The government will continue to monitor air quality, ready to reintroduce restrictions if necessary.
“The air quality has shown a significant improvement, allowing us to lift these measures.”

This decision to roll back restrictions comes as a relief to residents affected by previous measures, although monitoring will continue to ensure air quality remains within safe levels.

item.title: Hyderabad: Two arrested for ‘voyeurism’ at private college's girls hostel; principal booked - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Hyderabad: Two Arrested for Voyeurism at Girls Hostel as Principal Booked

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Hyderabad police have arrested two suspects for voyeurism following allegations from female students at a private engineering college who claimed that they were filmed in their hostel washrooms.

  • Two individuals accused of secretly filming female students have been arrested.
  • Protests erupted at the college following the allegations.
  • The police lodged a case under voyeurism and POCSO act.
  • The accused were found to have easy access to the washrooms due to their proximity to the hostel.
  • The principal and other officials are also facing accusations for neglecting the matter.

“Voyeurism means an act of secretly watching individuals inside a private infrastructure, a washroom, trial room, etc., with indecent intent.”

Further investigations are ongoing, with implications for the college administration being explored as well.

item.title: Media spreads misleading report on new OYO policy on unmarried couples - OpIndia
item.description:
Media spreads misleading report on new OYO policy on unmarried couples

Publication Date: 5th January 2025 | Source: OpIndia

On January 5th, 2025, major media outlets inaccurately reported that OYO Hotels & Homes had implemented a ban on unmarried couples from staying at its hotels, stirring outrage among patrons. However, the revised policy allows partner hotels to make their own decisions on this matter.

  • Several headlines suggested a blanket ban on unmarried couples at OYO Hotels.
  • The actual policy allows individual partner hotels discretion to accept or decline bookings from unmarried couples.
  • The change was reportedly made in response to feedback from civil society groups.
Pawan Sharma, Region Head of OYO North India, stated, “OYO is committed to upholding safe and responsible hospitality practices...”

The uproar stems from misunderstandings generated by misleading headlines rather than a decisive policy reversal by OYO.

item.title: GRAP 3 measures revoked in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves | Check restrictions lifted - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GRAP 3 measures revoked in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves

Date: Jan 05, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

The Commission of Air Quality Management (CAQM) has revoked the Stage III restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR due to improving air quality index (AQI) levels.

  • Stage III restrictions lifted due to favorable AQI trends.
  • Stage I and II measures still in effect, including a ban on non-essential construction work.
  • Classes up to grade 5 were previously shifted to a hybrid mode.
  • Restrictions on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles in effect, with exceptions for persons with disabilities.
  • Strong advice remains to follow GRAP-II restrictions due to potential changing weather conditions.
"Owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and better wind speed, the AQI of Delhi has been continuously improving" - CAQM's order citing the India Meteorological Department.

This decision comes as the sub-committee will continue to monitor the air quality situation closely.

item.title: AAP MP Sanjay Singh's jibe at PM Modi, BJP: 'Bin dulhe ki baraat' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
AAP MP Sanjay Singh's Jibe at PM Modi: 'A Marriage Procession Without the Groom'

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

AAP MP Sanjay Singh criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi during a rally in Rohini, taking aim at the BJP's failure to declare a chief ministerial candidate ahead of Delhi's assembly elections.

  • Singh mocked Modi's rally comments, stating that nothing would change due to PM's words and highlighting Delhi's pride in Arvind Kejriwal.
  • He claimed the BJP was 'walking ahead with a marriage procession without the groom', referring to their election strategy.
  • Modi had earlier urged Delhi voters to elect a BJP-led government, blaming the AAP for development failures in the capital.
  • Kejriwal reacted by asserting that central government projects wouldn't have happened without AAP's cooperation.
"Nothing will happen because of what PM Modi says in his speech. Delhi takes pride in Arvind Kejriwal and his work... wo bina dulhe ke baraat lekar nikle hain." - Sanjay Singh

The ongoing exchanges between AAP and BJP leaders indicate a heightened political rivalry as the Delhi assembly elections approach.

item.title: 'Roads Like Priyanka Gandhi's Cheeks': BJP Leader Bidhuri's Remark Draws Congress Ire - News18
item.description:
BJP Leader Ramesh Bidhuri's Comment About Priyanka Gandhi Sparks Outrage

Date: January 05, 2025, Source: News18

A political stir erupted after BJP’s Ramesh Bidhuri made an inappropriate comment regarding Priyanka Gandhi, stating that future roads will be like her cheeks if his party wins.

  • The remark drew immediate backlash from Congress, which announced plans to file an FIR against Bidhuri.
  • Delhi BJP chief Virendraa Sachdeva advised leaders to refrain from making derogatory remarks about women.
  • In his defense, Bidhuri later expressed regret and retracted his statement.
  • Congress labeled the BJP as anti-women and demanded accountability from its leadership.
“If anyone is hurt by my remark, I express regret over it and I take my words back…” - Ramesh Bidhuri

The incident reflects ongoing tensions and challenges in political discourse regarding gender sensitivity.

item.title: Indian-origin woman, adopted by Spanish couple, returns to Odisha after 15 years to find birth mother - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin woman, adopted by Spanish couple, returns to Odisha to find her biological mother after being abandoned 20 years ago.

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Sneha, a researcher in children's education in Spain, has traveled to India with her Spanish adoptive parents to trace her biological roots after being abandoned at a young age.

  • Sneha was abandoned at a year old and adopted by a Spanish couple in 2010.
  • She is eager to find her biological mother, Banalata, before returning to Spain for educational commitments.
  • The search helped her discover family details with the aid of local community members and police.
  • The Odisha police are involved in assisting Sneha in locating her mother, who is believed to be from Cuttack district.
“The purpose of my journey from Spain to Bhubaneswar is to find my biological parents, especially my mother. I want to find her and meet her.” - Sneha Enrique Vidal

Sneha's journey highlights the emotional quest for identity and familial connection, reflective of many adoption stories globally.

item.title: Pollution curbs under GRAP-3 lifted in Delhi-NCR, restrictions on vehicles eased - India Today
item.description:
Pollution curbs under GRAP-3 lifted in Delhi-NCR, restrictions on vehicles eased

Published On: Jan 5, 2025 | Source: India Today

The Centre's panel on air quality in Delhi-NCR announced the rollback of Stage 3 restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) following a decrease in pollution levels.

  • Delhi's air quality index (AQI) was recorded at 339 and 335 on Sunday.
  • Stage 1 and Stage 2 restrictions remain in place to prevent further deterioration.
  • BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles can now operate in the region.
  • Forecasts indicate AQI will remain in the 'poor' category in the upcoming days.
"Actions under Stage-I & II of the revised GRAP shall, however, remain invoked and be implemented, monitored and reviewed by all the agencies concerned in the entire NCR to ensure that the AQI levels do not slip further."

The relaxation of Stage 3 curbs is aimed at improving air quality while keeping some measures active to monitor and control pollution levels.
